===Origins===
The godlike entity [[Sise-Neg (Earth-74113)|Sise-Neg]] originally created a Haven for two creatures belonging to be the borderline between apes and men:{{r|X-Men Annual Vol 1 13}} ''[[Homo erectus]]''.{{r|Marvel Fact Files #8}}

A tribe descended from those two, and in the course of that tribe's migration every year, their leader and his mate would return to the Garden.{{r|X-Men Annual Vol 1 13}}

===Encountering the [[Serpent-Men]]===
[[File:Homo_erectus_from_X-Men Annual Vol 1 13_001.jpg|left|thumb]]
[[File:Homo_erectus_from_X-Men Annual Vol 1 13_002.jpg|left|thumb]]
[[File:Homo_erectus_from_X-Men Annual Vol 1 13_003.jpg|left|thumb]]
One year, those two encountered in the Paradise the "Tribe of Mighty [[Set (Earth-616)|Set]]", [[Serpent-Men]] in disguise, offering them a better life in exchange for their obedience, the murder of their tribe and help to approach the Space Gods bringing gifts.{{r|X-Men Annual Vol 1 13}}
[[File:Homo_erectus_from_X-Men Annual Vol 1 13_004.jpg|right|thumb]]
The Wanderers rejected the offer and truth was revealed. Retreating, the Wanderers reached their tribe and returned into battle to drove the Serpent-Men out of the Garden.{{r|X-Men Annual Vol 1 13}}

===[[First Host]] of the [[Celestials]]===
As the battle finished, the Wanderers could witness the [[First Host]] of the [[Celestials]] arriving in their starship, escorted by [[Gaea (Earth-616)|Gaea]] who smiled to the tribe, urging them to accept the gifts of the aliens.{{r|X-Men Annual Vol 1 13}}

[[Gammenon (Earth-616)|Gammenon the Gatherer]] took in appeased Wanderers, while the Serpent-Men tried to offer themselves, hoping their more evolved mind would favor them over the mammals, and were drove out of the scene by [[Arishem (Earth-616)|Arishem the Judge]].{{r|X-Men Annual Vol 1 13}}

The Celestials altered the genetic makeup of the Pre-Men, creating the unstable [[Deviants (Homo descendus)|Deviants]] who fled into hiding underground, the immortal and powerful [[Eternals (Homo immortalis)|Eternals]] who literally flied out,{{r|What If? #23}} and finally remaining Wanderers, who were left to evolve naturally into [[Homo sapiens|humans]] but granted latent genes that would eventually turn them into superhumans.{{r|X-Men Annual Vol 1 13}}

While those turned into Eternals or Deviants retreat among themselves, the exact whereabouts of the rest of the Tribe, those modified with latent genes, is unknown, but they obviously spread the latent genes into humanity.
